dataset.title: 2019 Orthophotos by Township
dataset.description:
The Tri-County Regional Planning Commission, on behalf of local government partners Logan County, Peoria County, Tazewell County, and Woodford County oversaw a digital orthophotography acquisition project. The color digital orthrophotography was flown by Pictometry International Corp. in 2019 during the Spring leaf-off (<30%) period covering project area boundaries of Logan County, Peoria County, Tazewell County, and Woodford County. 

The orthophotography available for download is within the Peoria County boundary only.  The orthophotography is composed of one single image per township boundary within Peoria County with a resolution of 6-inch GSD.  All images are in MrSID format with a total file size of 12GB-13GB.  *Note:  This is the second and final delivery with corrections applied from the vendor as of March 3, 2020. 

The aerial imagery is bound to the  Peoria County GIS Open Data License Agreement which can be found here:  https://data-peoriacountygis.opendata.arcgis.com/pages/peoria-county-gis-open-data-license-agreement.

dataset.title: Peoria County Census Data:  2010
dataset.description: This map spatially shows data from the 2010 census for the county of Peoria.

dataset.title: 2011 Orthophotography
dataset.description:
Peoria County contracted with the Illinois Department of Transportation to receive digital aerial imagery during spring leaf-off in 2011.  The digital aerial imagery covers the Peoria County boundary extent with a resolution of one foot.  The data is available for download in zip file format.  The zip file contains county-wide digital aerial imagery tiles in a MrSID compressed format.  A shapefile is also provided which contains the tile areas used for creating the MrSID files.  The zip file is 2.9 GB in size and can be downloaded by clicking Here.  For additional information and downloadable imagery in Illinois, please see the 2011 IDOT Orthophotography project site on the Illinois Geospatial Data Clearinghouse website:  https://clearinghouse.isgs.illinois.edu/data/imagery/2011-illinois-department-transportation-idot-orthophotography.


The aerial imagery is bound to the  Peoria County GIS Open Data License Agreement which can be found here:  https://data-peoriacountygis.opendata.arcgis.com/pages/peoria-county-gis-open-data-license-agreement.

dataset.title: 2003 Orthophotography
dataset.description:
Peoria County contracted with the Surdex Corporation to receive aerial imagery during spring leaf-off in 2003.  The aerial imagery covers the Peoria County boundary extent with resolutions of one foot in rural areas and six inches in the Peoria metro area.  The data is available for download in zip file format.  The zip file contains aerial imagery in a MrSID compressed format.  Each MrSID image covers an extent of a township boundary in Peoria County.  Higher quality imagery in TIF format is available upon request.  The delivery areas of the TIF imagery are in shapefile format and can be found in the zip file.  The zip file is 6 GB in size and can be downloaded by clicking Here.


The aerial imagery is bound to the  Peoria County GIS Open Data License Agreement which can be found here:  https://data-peoriacountygis.opendata.arcgis.com/pages/peoria-county-gis-open-data-license-agreement.

dataset.title: 2008 Orthophotography
dataset.description:
Peoria County contracted with the The Sanborn Map Company to receive aerial imagery during spring leaf-off in 2008.  The aerial imagery covers the Peoria County boundary extent with resolutions of one foot in rural areas and six inches in the Peoria metro area.  The data is available for download in zip file format.  The zip file contains aerial imagery in a MrSID compressed format per township boundary area extent, one county-wide aerial mosaic in MrSID format, and a shapefile of township boundaries.  The shapefile of township boundaries was used to create the MrSID aerials by township boundary area extent.  The zip file is 9.3 GB in size and can be downloaded by clicking Here.


Additional Metadata
Digital Photo Scale:  
  • 1" = 833' for the urban project area .
  • 1" = 1667' for the rural project area.
  • Alternate: 1" = 833' for the entire project area.
Project Size:  629 plus the 750ft buffer area.

Sun Angle:  Greater than 30 degrees above the horizon.

Spacing:  Full stereoscopic coverage.

Endlap:  60 percent, 80 percent in commercial areas.

Sidelap:  30 percent, 60 percent in commercial areas.

Crab:  Less than 3 degrees between and within any photo.

Tilt:  Less than 3% any photo, less than 5% between photos.

Flight Height Above Ground:  3,900'.

Image Type:  Color and Color IR.


The aerial imagery is bound to the  Peoria County GIS Open Data License Agreement which can be found here:  https://data-peoriacountygis.opendata.arcgis.com/pages/peoria-county-gis-open-data-license-agreement.

dataset.title: Driveways
dataset.description: Updates to Peoria County, driveways were finished in June 2018 by the Peoria County GIS - IT Services Department. The dataset was screen digitized using 6 inch resolution orthophotography which was captured during the spring of 2015 by Kucera International Inc.  Original data was compiled by Sanborn Mapping Company in 2008.

dataset.title: LIDAR Data
dataset.description:
This zip file contains LIDAR, Digital Terrain Models (DTM's), surface, and breakline datasets covering the extent of Peoria County.  The LIDAR data was captured during spring leaf-off in 2008.  There are eight databases in Esri's file geodatabase format which are broken down by eight areas in the County.  The DTM's conform to the ASPRS Class I Standards using the Illinois State Plane West coordinate system.

More recent LIDAR data for Peoria County, IL was captured in 2012 by the State of Illinois through the Illinois Height Modernization Program (ILHMP).  Please click Here to read about the program and data available for download.

This data is bound to the Peoria County GIS Open Data License Agreement which can be found here:  https://data-peoriacountygis.opendata.arcgis.com/pages/peoria-county-gis-open-data-license-agreement.

dataset.title: Contour Lines
dataset.description: Lidar generated 2 foot contour lines within Peoria County, Illinois.  Contour lines were compiled by the Sanborn Mapping Company in 2008.  The contour line database can be downloaded by clicking Here.  The contour line database is in Esri's file geodatabase format and is downloaded in a zip file compression format.  The contour line datasets are bound to the  Peoria County GIS Open Data License Agreement which can be found here:  https://data-peoriacountygis.opendata.arcgis.com/pages/peoria-county-gis-open-data-license-agreement.

dataset.title: 1997 Orthophotography

Black and white aerial mosaic flown during spring leaf-off in 1997.  The aerial covers the Peoria County boundary extent and resolution is 2 feet.  The aerial is in MrSID format and is downloaded in a compressed zip file format.  The zip file is 201 MB in size and can be downloaded by clicking Here.


The black and white aerial mosaic is bound to the  Peoria County GIS Open Data License Agreement which can be found here:  https://data-peoriacountygis.opendata.arcgis.com/pages/peoria-county-gis-open-data-license-agreement.

dataset.title: Pricing Guide
dataset.description:
The Peoria County GIS open data website provides GIS data, interactive maps, and digital maps free of charge under an open data license agreement.  Peoria County GIS also provides custom GIS services upon request for GIS data and digital maps not available on the open data website.  Please click the Download button to download and view the current custom GIS services pricing guide.  All custom services are charged at $60 per hour.

Contact Information
Email:  gis@peoriacounty.org

Physical Address
Peoria County Courthouse
IT Service Department - GIS Division
324 Main St.
Room G11
Peoria, IL 61602

dataset.title: 2019 Orthophoto Mosaic
dataset.description:
The Tri-County Regional Planning Commission, on behalf of local government partners Logan County, Peoria County, Tazewell County, and Woodford County oversaw a digital orthophotography acquisition project. The color digital orthrophotography was flown by Pictometry International Corp. in 2019 during the Spring leaf-off (<30%) period covering project area boundaries of Logan County, Peoria County, Tazewell County, and Woodford County. 

The orthophotography available for download is within the Peoria County boundary only.  The orthophotography is a single large image mosaic with a resolution of 6-inch GSD county-wide.  The image mosaic is in MrSID format with a file size of 15GB-16GB.  *Note:  This is the second and final delivery with corrections applied from the vendor as of March 3, 2020. 

The aerial imagery is bound to the  Peoria County GIS Open Data License Agreement which can be found here:  https://data-peoriacountygis.opendata.arcgis.com/pages/peoria-county-gis-open-data-license-agreement.

This map only further proves that the world is not static, but a dynamic environment that never ceases to change.

dataset.title: March 2016 Tornado Damage Paths
dataset.description: Feature Service generated from running the Enrich layer solution. Damage Paths were enriched

dataset.title: Damage Points
dataset.description: Two tornadoes were spotted in Peoria County, Illinois on March 15, 2016.  One tornado was an EF-2 and had a damage path of 7.6 miles.  The second tornado was an EF-0 with a damage path of 3.83 miles.  Numerous structures and trees were damaged from this super cell storm.  This map displays the tornado paths and damage locations.

dataset.title: Damage Paths
dataset.description: Two tornadoes were spotted in Peoria County, Illinois on March 15, 2016.  One tornado was an EF-2 and had a damage path of 7.6 miles. dataset.title: Cadastral Lines
dataset.description: The Peoria County Supervisor of Assessments department maintains the cadastral lines feature class in Peoria County, Illinois. This feature class uses The Sidwell Company's tag model. Types of cadastral lines included are: corporate limits, county line, miscellaneous line, monument linear, page match line, political township line, railroad centerline, railroad row, road centerline, road row, road vacation row, and water line (streams).

dataset.description: Urban enterprise zone boundaries in Peoria County, Illinois. This polygon feature class contains names of each enterprise zone, acres, and square miles. This feature class was updated on October 13, 2017 to include amendments 3 & 4.

dataset.description: Emergency 911 street centerlines within Peoria County, Illinois. The street centerlines include street names and addresses ranges. This feature class is used for emergency response and addressing.

dataset.description: This feature class contains address points within Peoria County, Illinois. Address points include property site addresses, owner addresses, owner names, tax codes, and property acres.

dataset.description: Municipality boundaries within Peoria County, IL. Boundaries are continually updated using recorded legal documents.

dataset.title: Peoria Promise
dataset.description: This feature class contains address points within Peoria County, Illinois for the Peoria Promise organization. The purpose of the feature class is to list property owners that are eligible for the Peoria Promise scholarship program. Please see the Peoria Promise website for more information: http://www.peoriapromise.org/eligibility

dataset.title: Voting Precincts
dataset.description: Polygon feature class contains all voting precincts within Peoria County, Illinois.

dataset.title: Polling Places
dataset.description: Point feature class containing polling places within Peoria County, Illinois. Attributes include: polling place, polling place address, polling place hours, handicap accessible (Yes/No), next election date, voter registration deadline, contact name, contact phone, contact email, polling place wait time (minutes), township, precinct names, precinct building photos.

dataset.title: Residential Sales
dataset.description: Point feature class contains residential home sales (Valid Sales Only) from January 2012 through July 1, 2017. Information includes parcel number, document number, property address, property type, tax year, lot values, improvements, total assessed values, acreage, and building attributes from the CAMA system.

dataset.title: Tax Parcels
dataset.description: The Peoria County Supervisor of Assessments department maintains all property tax boundaries in Peoria County, Illinois. This feature class contains property tax boundaries known as parcel boundaries. Attributes contained in this feature class include parcel numbers (PINs) and GIS acres.

dataset.description: The Peoria County Supervisor of Assessments department maintains subdivision and condo boundaries using recorded plats. Attributes contained in this feature class include subdivision and condo plat names, type, plat number, and page.
